dataSetInformation.common:synonyms: 无铅焊料+助焊剂,不含铅焊料+助焊剂
dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: The reaction caused by the flux with halogen activator is more intense than the flux used in lead-based solder to remove oxides. The more flux, the higher the content of volatile organic compounds (VOCs), which act as solvents. During the reflow period of the solder paste, the solvent may evaporate excessively. These two factors may cause a series of process problems. Nowadays, no-clean flux is widely used in solder paste to avoid additional cleaning processes and reduce production costs. According to industry analysis, the market share of no-clean flux is 40%. After the welding process, the flux residue on the board should be solid and inert. Such residues should not cause any reliability issues, such as corrosion or oxidation of solder joints or contact pads. However, some previous studies by Zhan and others have shown that residues of no-clean flux may cause reliability issues related to corrosion and electrochemical migration. In addition to corrosion or electrochemical migration issues, residues of no-clean flux may also cause other issues related to its insulation characteristics.
